node.title: Rittenhouse trial juror removed over joke about Jacob Blake shooting
node.description: Judge Bruce Schroeder said it was important to maintain public confidence in the case, and removing the juror was necessary.

node.title: ‘A Man Named Scott’ Review: Bending Genres, Coping With Struggles
node.description: This film about Kid Cudi is that rare musician-focused documentary, one as sensitive, fully formed and noble in its intentions as the artist himself.

node.title: Man Eaten by Piranhas After Jumping in Lake to Flee From Bees
node.description: The man's body was found disfigured by piranhas who tore some parts of his body and his face, according to a local Brazilian news publication.

node.title: Businesses Could Face $136K Fine for Violating Biden Vaccine, Testing Mandate
node.description: OSHA will perform programmed inspections and follow up on claims about businesses not enforcing the vaccine or testing and mask-wearing mandate.

node.title: Vaccine Mandates Live Blog: Deadline Set For Employees at Large Companies
node.description: The Biden administration announced a new deadline for employees at large companies to receive the COVID-19 vaccine. Follow Newsweek's liveblog for all the latest.

node.title: U.S. Vaccine Mandate Takes Effect Jan. 4, Each Violation Could Cost Companies Almost $14K
node.description: Workers can alternatively get tested at least once weekly for the virus and must wear a mask in the workplace.

node.title: White House implementing business vaccine mandate and testing rules
node.description: The emergency standard stipulates that employers have to choose either full vaccination or weekly testing for their employees within 30 days and implement the mandate within 60 days.

node.title: Diwali festivities draw hundreds of thousands in India, despite Covid concerns.
node.description: More than 680,000 people have traveled across the country as health experts cautioned that large-scale gatherings might fuel a wave of infections.

node.title: The New York City Marathon Route: A Five-Borough Tour
node.description: The 26.2-mile race is a tour of New York City on foot, complete with roaring crowds scattered across diverse neighborhoods.

node.title: Annie Leibovitz, the Un-Fashion Photographer
node.description: “Fashion wasn’t anything I wanted to be involved with,” she says. Yet the visually arresting images in “Wonderland” may be her strongest work.

node.title: UK approves Merck's antiviral COVID pill in world first
node.description: Britain becomes the first country in the world to approve Merck's COVID-19 antiviral pill, molnupiravir.

node.title: Detroit decriminalizes psychedelic mushrooms
node.description: The substance, called psilocybin, can be used to treat a variety of psychological issues, including depression, although scientists​ are still doing research.

node.title: Remains of 2 sailors killed at Pearl Harbor in 1941 identified
node.description: Talbert and Collier were among 429 crewmen killed on the USS Oklahoma. Their remains were among many that could not be identified for decades.

node.title: Scientists create hybrid pumpkin to withstand climate change
node.description: Rising temperatures could result in less pumpkin production, threatening the livelihoods of U.S. farmers who rely on the seasonal crop.

node.title: Meryl Streep for President
node.description: Meryl Streep explains how she prepared to play a fictional (and not especially competent) U.S. president in Adam McKay’s apocalyptic satire “Don’t Look Up.”

node.title: After 14 Years, Robert Plant and Alison Krauss Finally Reunite
node.description: The duo worked with T Bone Burnett on the million-selling triumph “Raising Sand,” in 2007. Its sequel is once again an alternative to nearly all of its pop contemporaries.

node.title: ‘Tick, Tick … Boom!’: A Musical Based on a Musical About Writing a Musical. We Explain.
node.description: Lin-Manuel Miranda’s directorial debut is an adaptation of a show by Jonathan Larson, creator of “Rent.” This guide unpacks the many layers.

node.title: Longest uptick of new COVID vaccinations in months
node.description: The pace of first doses has climbed for eight straight days, the longest stretch since August.

node.title: Climate change protesters block roads outside British Parliament
node.description: Lawmakers have blasted the "Insulate Britain" activists for "interfering with democracy" after weeks of protests disrupting traffic, but the group is undeterred.

node.title: Hawaii is easing restrictions and preparing to welcome back tourists.
node.description: The state is eager for its vacation industry to rebound after a devastating 2020 season.

node.title: The U.S. trade deficit rose as a surge of imports bogged down the supply chain.
node.description: The trade deficit in September climbed to $80.9 billion, a record. Imports rose slightly, while exports fell.

node.title: Authorities Arrest Analyst Who Contributed to Steele Dossier
node.description: Igor Danchenko, a Russia analyst who worked with Christopher Steele, the author of a dossier of rumors and unproven assertions about Donald J. Trump, was taken into custody as part of the Durham investigation.

node.title: Man Accused of Taking Photos of Girls at Target Had Child Porn on Phone: Police
node.description: He was arrested after police received reports from mothers that a man was taking pictures their daughters.

node.title: Don't Trust Mark Zuckerberg's Metaverse With Your Privacy, ProtonMail CEO Warns
node.description: Andy Yen, who founded ProtonMail in 2014, said the metaverse is "insidious" and that the link between data and profit conflicts with Meta's promises on privacy.

node.title: HPV vaccines slash cervical cancer rates up to 87%, study finds
node.description: If more people get HPV vaccines and regular screenings, "cervical caner will become a rare disease," one of the study's authors says.

node.title: Realtor Works Out How Much The Simpsons' Home at 742 Evergreen Terrace Is Worth
node.description: The four-bedroom house in Springfield features an attic and a basement, and the secretive "rumpus room."

node.title: Tiger King's Joe Exotic says he has "aggressive cancer"
node.description: "Carole Will have her own party over this!" Joe Exotic wrote on Twitter, revealing his cancer diagnosis.

node.title: NT records first community transmission case of COVID-19
node.description: The Northern Territory's first ever case of COVID-19 community transmission will send Katherine into a lockdown and Greater Darwin into a lockout  for 72 hours as of midnight.

node.title: Jobless claims sink to new pandemic low
node.description: Roughly 269,000 Americans sought unemployment benefits last week, a sign the job market continues to heal.

node.title: Magic Johnson on getting HIV diagnosis in 1991: "I just lost it"
node.description: It's been 30 years since basketball legend Magic Johnson stunned the world when he announced he had HIV.

node.title: FBI releases declassified documents on probing Saudi ties to 9/11
node.description: Agents for years investigated support given to several of the hijackers, focusing on whether three Saudi nationals had advance knowledge of the attacks.

node.title: White House implementing business' vaccine mandate and testing rules
node.description: The emergency standard stipulates that employers have to choose either full vaccination or weekly testing for their employees within 30 days and implement the mandate within 60 days, sources tell CBS News.

node.title: Homes for Sale in New York and Connecticut
node.description: This week’s homes are a five-bedroom in Lloyd Neck, N.Y., and a three-bedroom in Greenwich, Conn.

node.title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
node.description: This week’s properties are in Hell’s Kitchen and Sheepshead Bay, and on the Upper West Side.

node.title: How Californians Can Save More Water
node.description: Gov. Gavin Newsom has called for a 15 percent reduction in water usage, but we’re far from that target.

node.title: The Biden administration sets a Jan. 4 vaccination deadline for private sector workers.
node.description: The new guidance will cover 84 million workers, who will be required to be fully vaccinated or undergo weekly testing.

node.title: 3,000 Miles From Glasgow, a Town and Its Polar Bears Face the Future
node.description: In Churchill, climate change is not a looming danger. It imbues daily life.

node.title: ‘Dexter’ and the Shows That Wouldn’t Die
node.description: The revival of the serial-killer drama is TV’s latest refusal to let a supposedly finished franchise rest in peace.

node.title: $380,000 Homes in Alabama, Pennsylvania and Washington
node.description: A three-bedroom Tudor Revival-style home in Birmingham, an 1858 rowhouse in Philadelphia and a one-bedroom apartment in Seattle.

node.title: Walmart's Early Black Friday Event: The Best Homeware Deals on Kitchen Appliances, Vacuums and More
node.description: Bag early Black Friday discounts on homeware including an air fryer, the iRobot Roomba vacuum and other home goods.

node.title: Water, Vital Ingredient for Life, Found in Galaxy 13 Billion Light-Years Away
node.description: Studying the conditions of galaxies helps scientists to solve the mysteries of how stars, planets, and life evolved.

node.title: Over 8,000 Air Force Service Members Miss Vaccine Mandate Deadline
node.description: The Air Force said almost 97 percent of active-duty service members were at least partially vaccinated, while 800 had refused the shot. Almost 5,000 have pending religious exemption requests.

node.title: Australia among notable absences as dozens of nations pledge to phase out coal
node.description: More than 70 countries signed on to the deal at the COP26 climate summit in Scotland, but huge coal users and producers like Australia, China, India and the US are not on board.

node.title: Australia crushes Bangladesh to reignite World Cup hopes
node.description: Leg-spinner Adam Zampa takes five wickets as Australia decimate Bangladesh and put themselves in the drivers seat to make the semi-finals of the Twenty20 World Cup.

node.title: The Bank of England edges closer to rising interest rates, but holds steady.
node.description: Britain’s central bank said it would wait for more data on the labor market even as inflation is expected to climb to about 5 percent.

node.title: Liver donor, recipient running New York City Marathon together
node.description: Four years ago, Sara Kate Gillingham donated part of her liver to her friend Dave Kane. They see the race as a celebration of life and chance to raise awareness about organ donation.

node.title: Doug the potato may be the largest ever unearthed
node.description: Tipping the scales at an impressive 17 pounds, the tuber's official status is still pending with Guinness. Meanwhile, Doug is on ice, waiting to be turned into vodka.

node.title: Man charged in death of World War I vet missing since 1976
node.description: Martin Motta is arraigned on a murder charge in connection with the death George Seitz, who was 81 when he vanished in 1976.

node.title: Why inflation may no longer be considered "transitory"
node.description: The Federal Reserve describes higher inflation as fleeting, but economists expect it to stick around into 2022.

node.title: The U.K. approves Merck’s molnupiravir, making it the first pill to be endorsed for treating Covid.
node.description: The British authorities said that the antiviral drug was “safe and effective” in reducing the risk of hospitalization and death for those at increased risk of severe symptoms.

node.title: Four High School Students Suspended After Recreating George Floyd's Death on TikTok
node.description: The school in South Carolina sent an email home to students and parents confirming that they had been suspended for the rest of the school year.

node.title: Joe Biden's 2024 Odds Suffer After Virginia Election Loss
node.description: Following the Virginia elections, BetOnline saw the Democratic president's odds go from 7-2 to 4-1.

node.title: 2021 Election Results: GOP celebrates Youngkin's win in Virginia
node.description: In New Jersey, incumbent Governor Phil Murphy narrowly won reelection, CBS News projected Wednesday.

node.title: Man Charged in Abduction of 4-Year-Old Girl After 18-Day Search
node.description: The legal action came as the Australian authorities continued to address questions about how the police had been able to find Cleo Smith, who vanished from a remote campsite.

node.title: Tucker Carlson Says He Still Doesn't Know What Critical Race Theory Is
node.description: The Fox News host discussed the academic theory while praising Glenn Youngkin for making it a major focus of his election campaign.

node.title: Chelsea Sugar recalls raw and soft brown sugar
node.description: Chelsea Sugar is recalling its soft brown and raw sugar product, amid concerns about low level lead contamination.

node.title: U.K. is 1st country to okay use of Merck antiviral drug for COVID-19
node.description: The drugmaker is also seeking emergency approval in the U.S. and Europe for the first pill shown to treat the coronavirus, and it's sharing its formula.

node.title: "Rust" weapons boss says she doesn't know who inserted fatal bullet
node.description: Hannah Gutierrez Reed says she'd inspected the gun Alec Baldwin used but doesn't know how a live bullet ended up inside or why. Police said a shot from the weapon killed the film's cinematographer and wounded the director.

node.title: Review: ‘This Is Not a War Story,’ Nor Does Coming Home Mean Peace
node.description: This poignant drama directed by and starring Talia Lugacy follows a traumatized Marine as she tries to connect with a group of fellow veterans at home.

node.title: ‘Mark, Mary & Some Other People’ Review: Till Death Do They Waffle
node.description: In this romantic comedy, a couple opens their relationship to prove they can be married and modern.

node.title: ‘All Is Forgiven’ Review: A Distinctive First Feature
node.description: A father with a drug problem tries to reconnect with his daughter.

node.title: ‘The Beta Test’ Review: Paranoia in Hollywood
node.description: Jim Cummings stars as a phony talent agent who agrees to an anonymous sexual encounter in this unruly satire.

node.title: ‘A Cop Movie’ Review: When a Uniform Is a Costume
node.description: This strange and ambitious Mexican film plays like a combination of “Cops,” “F for Fake” and “When Harry Met Sally.”

node.title: ‘Beans’ Review: Growing Up Fast in the ’90s
node.description: A middle school student comes of age during a standoff between the police and Mohawk residents during the 1990 Oka crisis in Canada.

node.title: ‘Finch’ Review: Three for the Road
node.description: Tom Hanks, a dog and two robots take a post-apocalyptic road trip in this unexciting drama from Apple TV+.

node.title: Watch Incredible Moment Baby Zebra Shark Hatches From Mermaid's Purse
node.description: TikTok video showing the black and white baby shark emerging has been viewed over four million times.

node.title: Woman Found Shot Dead In Driveway, Fiancé Charged With Murder
node.description: Tereyl Devon Coleman, 29, was arrested after Raven Coleman was found dead with a gunshot wound to the chest in the driveway of a residence in Detroit.

node.title: 'It's all a bit of fun': Giant potato called Doug unearthed in New Zealand
node.description: Weighing in at almost 8 kilograms, Doug the potato vies for the heavyweight title in the Guinness World Records, after being unearthed by a New Zealand couple in August.

node.title: How young is too young to teach kids about race?
node.description: A culture war has erupted over critical race theory and how schools should grapple with the history of race and racism in America.

node.title: Jury views dramatic video of Kyle Rittenhouse fatally shooting man
node.description: Jurors peered at infrared video made by an FBI surveillance plane from almost 9,000 feet above the spot where the teen fatally shot Joseph Rosenbaum.

node.title: What’s the Matter With Scarsdale?
node.description: Democrats’ struggles with working-class voters seem to be getting worse.

node.title: Joe Biden Endorsement Destroyed Democrat Chances, GOP Virginia House Winner Says
node.description: GOP candidate AC Cordoza scored a surprise victory against incumbent Democratic delegate Martha Mugler in the 91st district race on November 3.

node.title: Prostate Cancer Symptoms Explained As Joe Exotic Says He Has Aggressive Form of Disease
node.description: The central character of Netflix's "Tiger King" series announced he is suffering from a major cause of death in American men.

node.title: For the Astros, a Stinging Loss and an Uncertain Future
node.description: Houston’s experience couldn’t save it in the World Series. With Carlos Correa hinting he might leave, there is no telling what the team might look like next season.

node.title: With Mammoth Blasts, Jorge Soler Wins World Series M.V.P.
node.description: He was hitting .192 when Atlanta traded for him and missed time with the coronavirus. But Soler’s homers put his team ahead in three games in the series.

node.title: Manhattan Valley: A ‘More Affordable Pocket of the Upper West Side’
node.description: Residents treasure this attainable neighborhood near the top of Central Park, where ‘everyone has an interesting story to tell.’

node.title: The Marathon Returns to a City Eager to Celebrate It
node.description: Runners, organizers and spectators are preparing for New York’s first marathon since the onset of the pandemic, another milestone in the city’s long journey of recovery.

node.title: The Heart and Soul of a Franchise Shines Through
node.description: Freddie Freeman might have played his final game for Atlanta on Tuesday. Even if he did, he has already delivered on a promise he made to honor his mother.

node.title: Auckland councillors divided over proposed housing density law
node.description: Auckland councillors are divided over proposed new rules that would make it easier to build houses in the city.

node.title: Anti-Muslim bias prompted city to reject mosque, ACLU suit claims
node.description: The lawsuit alleges that aldermen in the northern Mississippi city of Horn Lake turned down an application to build the mosque due to prejudice and asks that the decision be reversed.

node.title: OPEC and Russia will ponder oil output under pressure from Biden.
node.description: At a meeting on Thursday, big oil producers are likely to juggle U.S. ties, climate change pressures and their own economics.

node.title: 5 Takeaways from the First Days of the Climate Summit
node.description: The world leaders have left Glasgow. Now negotiators must hunker down to turn pledges into reality.

node.title: A 'McCarthy-Like Web': Jones Bans NBC From Jonestown
node.description: Jim Jones didn't want NBC in Jonestown partly because he had undergone a huge change thanks to his lifestyle of drink and drugs.

node.title: Adorable Puppy Rescued After Almost Drowning in Shipwreck Off Alaska
node.description: The eight-month-old pup had been thrown into freezing water when her owner's fishing vessel capsized near Sitkalidak Island.

node.title: Who Was Charles K. Kao? Today's Google Doodle Celebrates Physicist's Birth
node.description: The British-American physicist, born in Shanghai on November 4, 1933, was known for laying the foundation for high-speed data communication.

node.title: Tulsi Gabbard Calls Glenn Youngkin's Virginia Win a 'Victory for All Americans'
node.description: The former democratic representative and presidential candidate seemed to take swipes at Terry McAuliffe's stance on the critical race theory debate.

node.title: It took three years for Department of Child Protection to pass report on teen's suicide to state coroner
node.description: An independent report looking into a decision to remove a boy from his foster care home and into residential care before he took his own life, has just been handed to the state coroner, despite being commissioned more than three years ago.

node.title: T20 live: Aussies face Bangladesh in must-win World Cup encounter
node.description: Australia's campaign at the men's T20 World Cup is on the line, as Justin Langer's side attempts to keep its semi-final hopes alive. Follow our ScoreCentre.

node.title: Principal knocked unconscious, allegedly by student, in Boston school
node.description: The principal's injuries are serious but not life-threatening, sources say. The school was to be closed for a day.

node.title: Benedict Cumberbatch and the Monsters Among Us
node.description: The actor is earning some of the best reviews of his career for his turn as a vicious bully in “The Power of the Dog.” Here’s what it took to become that seething cowboy.

node.title: John Banville, the Contemporary Novelist Who Avoids Contemporary Novels
node.description: “I read very little new fiction these days, to my shame and regret. ... So much of it seems to me mere prattle. Isn’t that awful?”

node.title: Poem: We Feel Now a Largeness Coming On
node.description: Tracy K. Smith reminds us how “being called all manner of things / from the dictionary of shame,” we do learn to become something mighty.

node.title: Judge John Hodgman on the Uncapped Water Bottle
node.description: A “clumsy fellow” demands his partner be more conscientious with her hydration.

node.title: For Britain’s Seaside Resorts, Rejuvenation in Small Doses
node.description: A look at three spots that have weathered challenges in very different ways.

node.title: Florida Attracts More Buyers in Search of Better Deals
node.description: One of the places luring property hunters is Hallandale Beach, which also offers a touch of tranquillity

node.title: They Wanted a Balcony in Brooklyn on a Budget. Which Option Would You Choose?
node.description: A young couple searched Midwood and Kensington for a one-bedroom with enough outdoor space to have a small garden — and maybe a dishwasher in the kitchen. Here’s what they found.

node.title: Ew, David, Your Book Is a Best Seller!
node.description: What went on behind the scenes on “Schitt’s Creek”? Now readers can find out.

node.title: Do Gun Rights Depend on Abortion Rights? That’s Now Up to the Supreme Court.
node.description: The outcome of a Texas law targeting abortion will provide the answer.

node.title: Is the Problem Facebook? Or the Internet?
node.description: Tech reporter Casey Newton takes us inside the Facebook Papers consortium, the company’s failure to be held to account and why the problem is bigger than any one company.

node.title: 5 Takeaways from Day 3 of the Climate Summit
node.description: The world leaders have left Glasgow. Now negotiators must hunker down to turn pledges into reality.
